content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR 2024 MBA Internship Program - Co-Investment & Partnerships (Capital Markets)
New York
KKR is seeking current 1st-year MBA students (graduation date: Spring 2025) for our 2024 MBA Internship Program and to be an active part of a team-oriented environment. The internship is 10-weeks in length and will take place in our New York office. Following the conclusion of the internship, 2025 full-time offers may be extended to exceptional performers.
Capital Markets – Co-Investment & Partnerships
This team leads co-investments, private placements and secondary opportunities alongside the firm’s investments across all asset classes (i.e. Private Equity, Real Assets, Real Estate, Infrastructure, and Growth Equity) and geographies. The team provides capital markets advice and develops and implements traditional and non-traditional capital solutions for direct investments as well as for companies seeking financing through co-investments and partnerships. The team plays an active role in Investment Committee meetings and gains exposure to senior figures across the firm. This is a lean, exciting, and entrepreneurial team at KKR.
For this role, responsibilities will include assisting deal captains in all areas of transaction oversight including building relationships with clients, guiding them through the investment process (including preparing materials, answering Q&A, participating in client calls), and executing co-investment opportunities. The focus of transactions will be co-investment syndications, minority investments, and private placements. This is a deal-focused group, and you will be expected to dig deep into every deal and understand the process from an investor mindset. In addition to deal-related work, you will be responsible for maintaining the team’s marketing materials, using data to create presentations for relationship managers and clients, preparing a quarterly market update on the co-investment sector, and various other work streams to build a foundational knowledge of the co-investment space. You will cultivate deep relationships with LPs and other investors to help guide their investment teams through co-investment opportunities. 
The team prides itself on its culture and collegial environment and is looking for candidates who are smart, driven, and proactive. This is ideally a long-term, career-track role. The team works on the vast majority of deals executed globally by the firm and would be a great fit for candidates who want to combine an investment role with direct investor engagement.
Position Description and Responsibilities

Examining industry trends and identifying investment themes
Contributing to key diligence work streams
Business analysis of a broad range of companies and industries
Financial modeling
Assistance in development of actionable investments, including long-term fixed income return strategies, as well as identifying relative value, capital structure arbitrage, mezzanine, and distressed debt opportunities
Analyzing deal terms and covenant structures
Working on LP and GP led secondary transactions in conjunction with other teams within the firm

Primary Qualifications and Skills

Current 1st year MBA student with anticipated graduation date of Spring 2025
Prior investment banking, secondary, co-invest or general buyside experience, and can demonstrate raw analytical horsepower and finance / modeling skills
Strong candidates should have the ability to multi-task and clearly communicate qualitative and quantitative concepts
Candidates should embody KKR’s core values, in particular: unquestioned integrity, a strong work ethic and a commitment to teamwork
An ideal candidate will have a genuine enthusiasm and curiosity for investing, a strong understanding of fundamental business analysis and an outstanding academic record
A candidate must possess superior analytical and quantitative skills; a foundational understanding of accounting financial concepts; exceptional written, interpersonal, and communication skills; attention to detail; and a maturity that enables the candidate to contribute to a collaborative and constructive work environment
A candidate should also demonstrate good investment instincts, analytical capability and finance, accounting and modeling skills
It is essential for a candidate to be a self-starter and motivated, with the ability to multi-task, prioritize and work both independently and within teams

Application Instructions:

Deadline to apply is December 3rd -- 11:59pm ET
You can submit a maximum of 2 applications
